extendedInfo.description: Get your breaking news, headlines and Storm Team 4 weather when you want it, wherever you are, and itâs all FREE! Breaking news, weather, traffic alerts from southeast Wisconsin are available at your fingertips with Newsradio 620 WTMJ's app. Our app offers extensive coverage of the stories that matter most to you, including the latest on local and state-wide government, with headlines fresh from Madison. Our dynamic sports team and live game coverage keeps you in the loop with your favorite Wisconsin teams, while our award-winning talk show hosts Jeff Wagner and Charlie Sykes provide the best in conservative perspective. Start your day with Gene Mueller and our Wisconsin's Morning News team and continue it throughout the day easily with our app, powered by WTMJ.com. App features include: -Streaming capabilities for easy listening on the go -The latest news headlines from Wisconsin's Morning News and Wisconsin's Afternoon news, including reports from Gene Mueller, Jon Byman and Jodi Becker -Local, state and national political commentary from Jeff Wagner and Charlie Sykes -Sports information on your favorite teams, including the Green Bay Packers, the Milwaukee Brewers, the Milwaukee Bucks, the Marquette Golden Eagles and the Wisconsin Badges, including commentary from the Freak and the Geek, Greg Matzek and Jeff Falconio -The latest weather forecasts from our partner Storm Team 4, including Chief Meteorologist John Malan and Scott Steele -Your iContribute photos, including Scott Steele's Pet pics and your favorite local sports teams -News, sports and weather photos -Videos from our latest newscasts, as well as web exclusive videos -Traffic updates for your commute -Blogs from your favorite Newsradio 620 WTMJ personalities, including Charlie Sykes, Jeff Wagner, Gene Mueller, John Mercure, Jeff Falconio and Greg Matzek -Station contests and promotions -School closings -An easy way to listen to connect with our partner, TODAY'S TMJ4 -A way to submit your story or photo to our station via iContribute

reviews.title: It\'s ok
reviews.comment: The wisn 12 app is better, but they both offer some different news items, so I keep it around.
reviews.author: Steve Murawski

reviews.comment: The app keeps cutting out and I have to keep reloading it. Frustrating.
reviews.author: Wendy Tolonen

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment: You\'d be better off with yahoo news lol. Thats saying something. Come on tmj! Content is garbage, delivered by third rate journalists. They call this an app, but it\'s just an excuse to say \"see, we\'re mobil now\". The only thing that saves this app is you get brewers and packers games... oh wait you don\'t!  Sad and pathetic. Zero stars
reviews.author: David Monticelli

reviews.title: Unable to turn off app.
reviews.comment: After acquiring the app and listening to the radio I was unable to turn it off without turning off my cell phone. Almost afraid to try it again.
reviews.author: Barbara Matz

reviews.title: Packer game.... Not!
reviews.comment: Thought it would be nice to LISTEN to the Packer game while away from a TV. Not able to connect to \"LISTEN\" even after a few attempts to install/ uninstall.  It\'s just not a good app!!
reviews.author: David Rehfeld

reviews.comment: Always listen!! Now reading and that\'s even better!!!

reviews.title: Sux
reviews.comment: Have to click multiple times to turn radio off, can\'t just hit menu and exit.  Crashed almost everytime I used it.  Removed after 4 or 5 uses.  As is often the case wth streaming a lot of programming not available....  can\'t I just get an am radio on my phone?   arghhhh

reviews.title: Home to Bob, Partners & TTBBC
reviews.comment: Can I get a message to Mr.Mark Antinacio-Hay \"Uncle\"Mark Watch our team now.../I am looking forward for 17-2 next 19 games. Hello /Good by Card-nulls. Should only be a guess. Watch! Thanks : Bryan

reviews.title: Awrsome!!!
reviews.comment: Great app
reviews.author: Christopher Talbert

reviews.title: Good, but needs simple fixes
reviews.comment: I like this app, because I can listen to the radio programming when I\'m not near a radio.  But there\'s no good way to exit out of the Listen mode.  It\'s much easier to listen to WISN through the iHeart Radio app than it is to listen to WTMJ through their app.  I\'d give it a higher rating if the ability to listen and stop listening was improved.
reviews.author: Karl Boettcher

reviews.title: No Sports
reviews.comment: If you can\'t listen to any if the sports they broadcast, why bother.
reviews.author: Salvatore Fontanazza
